intro: Ardisia lasseri, commonly known as the glossy buckeye, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its striking, glossy, dark green leaves and showy, red-orange berries that appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Ardisia lasseri is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various garden environments.
